etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin juniperus

definitions: an evergreen shrub or small tree that bears berrylike cones, widely distributed throughout Eurasia and North America. Many kinds have aromatic cones or foliage.

notes.text: Genus Juniperus, family Cupressaceae: many species, including the shrubby common juniper (J. communis), the berries of which are used for flavoring gin

shortDefinitions: evergreen shrub or small tree that bears berrylike cones
